author: jimmygchen
content:
<@&688090867927482525> is there any known issues with `getPayloadV5` around fulu fork transition? I was running a local lighthouse-geth network, and saw a lot of missed blocks from the fulu fork epoch, and it seems like we're getting inconsistent proof lengths from `getPayloadV5`.

The error from lighthouse looks like this
```
[cl-1-lighthouse-geth] Sep 10 00:53:00.136 ERROR Data column for publication is gossip-invalid  column_index: 0, slot: 43, error: InconsistentCommitmentsLength { cells_len: 7, commitments_len: 9 }
```

It lasted for about 2 epochs and things went back to normal. I'm going to add some more logging to see what exactly we're getting

author: jimmygchen
content: @geth is there any known issues with

author: barnabasbusa
content: We have started to start up to recover devnet 3.

author: __flcl
content: As for the testnet forks timestamps, we just need more time before everybody will be ready to provide a stable enough release, right? If so do we need time till 22th or more?

author: siladu
content: While monitoring the non-finality test today, I noticed some gaps in the metrics and grafana was returning 503 a few hours ago - pretty sure it wasn't just Besu metrics...can you confirm if there was a general issue?

author: barnabasbusa
content: can confirm, we had a period where metrics got cut off sorry about that

author: funnygiulio
content: we will need an heads up for this too to prepare because we are planning to do a major release soon

author: funnygiulio
content: i'd say we will definetely be ready by end of this month

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Looks like <@&898338229407870986> and lodestar<@&595681771690000403> nodes have been mostly stuck on head progression after the EL nodes have been wiped and the new versions have been rolled out. 

We have not wiped the DBs of the CLs. So we expect to basically reorg over a day of slots and try to recover from there in forward sync. Can the client devs pls take a look?

author: barnabasbusa
content:
<@&1367819653279125645> we have added eth_config verification on execution client page on dora: https://dora.fusaka-devnet-3.ethpandaops.io/clients/execution
You gonna see a little triangle next to your client's name if there is a mismatch to expected values.
